title: Marquette Golden Eagles Rely on Seniors for NCAA Tournament Run
text:
Marquette Golden Eagles Rely on Seniors for NCAA Tournament Run
The Marquette Golden Eagles menâ€™s basketball team is set for their fourth consecutive NCAA Tournament, showcasing the experience of seniors David Joplin, Kam Jones, and Stevie Mitchell. After a setback at the Big East Tournament, they are now focused on their first-round matchup against New Mexico, with a 23-9 record and a No. 7 seed in the South Region. Coach Shaka Smart emphasizes the importance of fan presence, particularly since Cleveland offers a relatively short drive for supporters. The team looks to capitalize on their playoff experience as they aim to progress further this year.
- Marquette is 4-for-4 in NCAA Tournament appearances under Coach Shaka Smart.
- Kam Jones averaged 19.3 points and 5.9 assists per game this season, ranking in the top 50 nationally.
- The Golden Eagles will play their first-round game in Cleveland, a strategic site choice for fans.
- Despite recent struggles, Marquette remains a strong contender given their tournament experience.
Moving forward, Marquette must overcome New Mexico's fast-paced style to secure a place in the next round. If they succeed, a potential rematch with Michigan State awaits, along with others in the Sweet 16. Each game is pivotal as they seek to continue their tournament run.
Bottom LineMarquette's experience and coaching acumen will be crucial as they navigate the unpredictable NCAA Tournament. Focusing on each matchup while leveraging fan support could be the key to their success in this year's March Madness.
